import json
from datetime import datetime
from azure.data.tables import TableClient

class ETLlogger:
    def __init__(self,_config):
        self._config = _config
        """Connect to Azure table"""
        self.connection_str = "DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName=" + _config.get('storage.account_name') + ";AccountKey=" + \
                         _config.get('storage.account_key') + ";EndpointSuffix=core.windows.net"
        self.table_service = TableClient.from_connection_string(self.connection_str,
                                                           table_name=_config.get('logging.table_name'))

    def update_logs(self, task, result):
        tday = datetime.now()
        partition_key = tday.strftime("%Y%m%d")
        row_key = self._config.get('source_flag') + "-" + tday.strftime("%Y%m%d-%H%M%S")
        properties = {
            'source': self._config.get('source_flag'),
            'task': task,
            'result': result
        }

        entity_values = {'PartitionKey': partition_key,
                         'RowKey': row_key,
                         'Result': json.dumps(properties)}

        self.table_service.create_entity(entity=entity_values)
